results.title: Pooling around
results.creator_credit: Paul Galan and Continental Oil Company
results.brief_description: Looks at a van pool commuter program established by the American firm Conoco. With the aim of energy conservation, employees commute to work in a van. Shows the beneficial aspects for the company and the employees.
results.description: Looks at a van pool commuter program established by the American firm Conoco. With the aim of energy conservation, employees commute to work in a van. Shows the beneficial aspects for the company and the employees.

results.title: Pool sharks
results.creator_credit: Edwin Middleton, Gaumont-British Instructional and Essex Films
results.brief_description: W.C. Fields’ first film displaying his prowess at the pool table; rivals for the same girl find that a “friendly” game does not help to settle the matter. A useful comparison with later films in terms of the development of character, history of comedy and the role of women. Written by W.C. Fields and musical score by Stuart Oderman.

results.title: Pool of contentment
results.creator_credit: Richard Massingham and Central Office of Information
results.brief_description: Explains how a typing pool operates in a British Government Department; points out common faults on the part of officers giving dictation or sending drafts to bee typed; suggests remedies for these faults, also ways in which typists may attain greater efficiency.

results.title: Ponies of Miklaengi
results.creator_credit: Gary Templeton, Daniel Smith and Phoenix Films
results.brief_description: Situated in Iceland, two youngsters round up sheep on their horses, eat and sing with the family and search for three lost sheep, all amongst beautiful scenery.

results.title: Ponies
results.creator_credit: Hector Lemieux, Joe Hayward and Moreland-Latchford Productions
results.brief_description: Natural sounds and music combine with the beauty of colour and motion to present the pageantry of the pony world. On hilltops, in streams, in wood and meadow, Welsh ponies are seen and heard in a kaleidoscope of mood and motion. A foal is born. A pony is schooled for the show ring.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Hector Lemieux, Joe Hayward and Moreland-Latchford Productions

results.title: Pong
results.brief_description: Pong is a tennis game with simple two-dimensional graphics. It is one of the earliest arcade video games and the first sports arcade video game.

constellations_other.name: The first home console and the art of ping pong
constellations_other.description: An exploration of tennis and ping pong throughout the moving image.

results.description:
Pong is a tennis game with simple two-dimensional graphics. It is one of the earliest arcade video games and the first sports arcade video game.

In Pong a ping-pong battle takes place in which a player attempts to defeat their opponent by scoring more points. It was originally manufactured by Atari Incorporated in 1972 and created by Allan Alcorn as an exercise of programming skill. Although other arcade games were manufactured before Pong, it was the first to reach a large audience. Pong was the first commercially successful arcade video gaming machine, which helped create the video game industry alongside the release of world’s first home console, Magnavox Odyssey.

Soon many businesses started to copy the gameplay used in Pong for their own games and as a result, Atari encouraged its staff to produce more innovative games. The company released multiple sequels with original features added to the familiar gameplay. In 1975 Atari released Pong exclusively in Sears retail outlets as a home version. It was the commercial success Atari had hoped for and led to a series of sold copies. It has been remade for multiple platforms following its release during the years. A number of television programs have parodied Pong and it has often been referenced in other video games. Pong has also been a part of many video game and cultural exhibitions.

results.title: Pong
results.brief_description: Pong, the 2007 single from German cyber-goth band Eisenfunk, extensively uses samples from the game Pong, as well as featuring a stylised version of it in the video clip.

constellations_other.name: The first home console and the art of ping pong

results.title: Ponette
results.creator_credit: Jacques Doillon, Alain Sarde and Arrow Productions
results.brief_description: Powerful and touching film portrayal of a four-year-old girl’s struggle to understand the meaning of death after she loses her mother in a car accident in which she herself is also injured. Following her mother’s funeral, Ponette is left by her father in the care of her aunt, where she and her two cousins are largely left to resolve their confusion and loss on their own. Told by her aunt about Jesus’ resurrection, Ponette patiently awaits her mother’s return, a reunion she dreams about incessantly. Related entirely from the perspective of the young girl, the film is dominated by the performance of Victorie Thivisol who won best actress at the 1996 Venice Film Festival for her role. Doillon’s success in entering the mind of a child grappling with the concept of death, stemmed from his writing and auditioning process. He established a workshop for four- and five-year-olds selected during a comprehensive audition process and worked for six months with the children, acting out scenarios and creating sketches, asking their opinions on a variety of subjects and adapting his script from their dialogue. This unique collaboration - giving the children a full range of expression - solidifies the film’s emotional base. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: Ponds: an introduction
results.creator_credit: Donald Walton, Anvil Films and Record Group and Seabourne Enterprises
results.brief_description: Explains the yearly cycle of pond life, the dependence on warmth and light for growth and the interchange of oxygen and carbon dioxide. The pond returns to rest period when days shorten and the water becomes cold and minerals are replenished from decaying plants and animals in readiness for the circle to begin again.
